alert.note: Alert for Albemarle; Augusta (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:40PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and western Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Albemarle, City of Charlottesville and Nelson. In western Virginia, Augusta and Rockingham. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 PM EST, Stream gauges indicated that flooding is occurring along the Mechum and North Fork Rivanna Rivers. Flooding in other small streams across the county could occur as water levels continue to rise. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen this evening. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charlottesville... Crozet... Sherando... Shipman... Schuyler... Free Union... Wintergreen... Afton... Montebello... Campbell... Westmoreland... Hollymead... Nellysford... Ivy... Arrington... Scottsville... Esmont... Lovingston... Covesville... Batesville... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
